result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM1129, 16CF1176, 16CF1162, 15CF923, 16CM93, 16CF666 called: 1:22am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Robin Kennedy.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable;  Waivers of Prelim. filed in 16CF1176, 16CF1162 and 16CF666.

PRELIM WAIVERS>>
Court questions deft as to waivers.
Court finds waivers freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC in all 3 cases - Defendant bound over for arraignments & trials.  
Informations filed.  Readings Waived.


State moves to:
15CM1129 - Ct. 1 (Poss Controlled Substance)>>ENTER Judgment and find defendant guilty.
16CF1176 - Ct. 1 (Poss Meth/On or Near Certain Places)>>AMEND to Delete "On or Near Certain Places" Enhancer
16CF1176 - Cts. 2, 3, 4, and 5>>all D&RI
16CF1162 - Cts. 2, 3, 4, and 5>>all D&RI
15CF923 - Cts. 2 and 3>>both D&RI
16CM93>> D&RI entire file
16CF666 - Cts. 1, 4, and 5>>all D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CF1176 - Ct. 1 (Poss Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST
16CF1162 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST
15CF923 - Ct. 1 (Poss Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST
16CF666 - Ct. 2 (Poss Para to Produce Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST
16CF666 - Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS:
15CM1129>>82 days MCJ w/huber if defendant found eligible under jail classification system; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.
As to ALL other cases>> Sentence W/held; 3 years probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO including but not limited to AODA and any follow up recommended; Absolute sobriety; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; in 16CF1176 Ct. 1 ONLY--82 days MCJ w/huber if defendant found eligible under jail classification system, concurrent to sentence in 15CM1129.

COURT also orders upon agreement of both parties that defendant must be released for inpatient care at HCC for 21 days once there is room in the program, and then defendant must return to MCJ immediately for any unserved remainder of jail sentence; This inpatient time does NOT count towards her jail time/is not concurrent.
